cloud.description: Cloud metadata about where the monitored service is running.

account.description: Account where the monitored service is running.

availability_zone.description: AvailabilityZone where the monitored service is running, e.g. us-east-1a

instance.description: Instance on which the monitored service is running.

machine.description: Machine on which the monitored service is running.

project.description: Project in which the monitored service is running.

provider.description: Provider that is used, e.g. aws, azure, gcp, digitalocean.

region.description: Region where the monitored service is running, e.g. us-east-1

service.description: Service that is monitored on cloud

name.description: Name of the cloud service, intended to distinguish services running on different platforms within a provider, eg AWS EC2 vs Lambda, GCP GCE vs App Engine, Azure VM vs App Server.

labels.description: Labels are a flat mapping of user-defined tags. Allowed value types are string, boolean and number values. Labels are indexed and searchable.

process.description: Process metadata about the monitored service.

argv.description: Argv holds the command line arguments used to start this process.

pid.description: PID holds the process ID of the service.

ppid.description: Ppid holds the parent process ID of the service.

title.description: Title is the process title. It can be the same as process name.

service.description: Service metadata about the monitored service.

agent.description: Agent holds information about the APM agent capturing the event.

ephemeral_id.description: EphemeralID is a free format ID used for metrics correlation by agents

name.description: Name of the APM agent capturing information.

version.description: Version of the APM agent capturing information.

environment.description: Environment in which the monitored service is running, e.g. `production` or `staging`.

framework.description: Framework holds information about the framework used in the monitored service.

language.description: Language holds information about the programming language of the monitored service.

name.description: Name of the used programming language

version.description: Version of the used programming language

node.description: Node must be a unique meaningful name of the service node.

runtime.description: Runtime holds information about the language runtime running the monitored service

architecture.description: Architecture of the system the monitored service is running on.

configured_hostname.description: ConfiguredHostname is the configured name of the host the monitored service is running on. It should only be sent when configured by the user. If given, it is used as the event's hostname.

container.description: Container holds the system's container ID if available.

id.description: ID of the container the monitored service is running in.

cpus.description: CPUCores holds the number of CPU cores of the system on which the monitored service is running.

detected_hostname.description: DetectedHostname is the hostname detected by the APM agent. It usually contains what the hostname command returns on the host machine. It will be used as the event's hostname if ConfiguredHostname is not present.

hostname.description: Deprecated: Use ConfiguredHostname and DetectedHostname instead. DeprecatedHostname is the host name of the system the service is running on. It does not distinguish between configured and detected hostname and therefore is deprecated and only used if no other hostname information is available.

kubernetes.description: Kubernetes system information if the monitored service runs on Kubernetes.

namespace.description: Namespace of the Kubernetes resource the monitored service is run on.

uid.description: UID is the system-generated string uniquely identifying the Pod.

memory.description: Memory holds the memory of the system on which the monitored service is running, in bytes.

network.description: Network holds information about the network that the system is connected to. This is only relevant for browsers and mobile devices.  See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NetworkInformation for more details on how these fields should be set and interpreted for browsers.

downlink.description: Downlink holds the effective bandwidth estimate in megabits per second.

effectivetype.description: EffectiveType describes the effective network type as one of a discrete set of network types, e.g. 'slow-2g', '2g', '3g', or '4g'.

rtt.description: RTT holds the estimated effective round-trip time of the current connection, in milliseconds.

savedata.description: SaveData reports whether or not reduced data usage has been enabled on the client device.

platform.description: Platform name of the system platform the monitored service is running on.

user.description: User metadata, which can be overwritten on a per event basis.

id.description: ID identifies the logged in user, e.g. can be the primary key of the user
